item.title: Nathan add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "at the bottom of the ocean is a layer of water that has never moved…" -- Anne Carson

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "You must stay drunk on writing so reality cannot destroy you." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Nathan add a quote by J.R.R. Tolkien
item.description: "It's the job that's never started as takes longest to finish." -- J.R.R. Tolkien

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Having a baby is like suddenly getting the world's worst roommate." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "If your wife locks you out of the house, you don't have a problem with your door." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Alanis Morissette
item.description: "the truth of who we are is innate goodness, and the whole journey is really about removing any obstacle or false belief that keeps us from knowing that" -- Alanis Morissette

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: "Concentrate on what you want to say to yourself and your friends. Follow your inner moonlight; don't hide the madness. You say what you want to say when you don't care who's listening." -- Allen Ginsberg

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Natalie Goldberg
item.description: "Write what disturbs you, what you fear, what you have not been willing to speak about. Be willing to be split open." -- Natalie Goldberg

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Jeannette Walls
item.description: "Mom always said people worried too much about their children. Suffering when you are young is good for you, she said. It immunized your body and your soul." -- Jeannette Walls

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Allen Ginsberg
item.description: "Poetry is not an expression of the party line. It's that time of night, lying in bed, thinking what you really think, making the private world public, that's what the poet does." -- Allen Ginsberg

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Anne Lamott
item.description: "Perfectionism is the voice of the oppressor, the enemy of the people. It will keep you cramped and insane your whole life, and it is the main obstacle between you and a shitty first draft. I think perfectionism is based on the obsessive belief that if you run carefully enough, hitting each stepping-stone just right, you won't have to die. The truth is that you will die anyway and that a lot of people who aren't even looking at their feet are going to do a whole lot better than you, and have a lot more fun while they're doing it." -- Anne Lamott

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Ray Bradbury
item.description: "Ours is a culture and a time immensely rich in trash as it is in treasures." -- Ray Bradbury

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Tim Gunn
item.description: "I believe that treating other people well is a lost art." -- Tim Gunn

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "Then a miracle occurred in the form of a plate of sandwiches. Geryon took three and buried his mouth in a delicious block of white bread filled with tomatoes and butter and salt. He thought about how delicious it was, how he liked slippery foods, how slipperiness can be of different kinds. I am a philosopher of sandwiches, he decided. Things good on the inside." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "Small, red, and upright he waited, gripping his new bookbag tight in one hand and touching a lucky penny inside his coat pocket with the other, while the first snows of winter floated down on his eyelashes and covered the branches around him and silenced all trace of the world." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "To lose balance sometimes for love is part of living a balanced life." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Elizabeth Gilbert
item.description: "God dwells within you, as you." -- Elizabeth Gilbert

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Gustave Flaubert
item.description: "Be steady and well-ordered in your life so that you can be fierce and original in your work." -- Gustave Flaubert

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "The beauty of the world, which is so soon to perish, has two edges, one of laughter, one of anguish, cutting the heart asunder." -- Virginia Woolf

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Lydia Davis
item.description: "Art is not in some far-off place." -- Lydia Davis

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Lydia Davis
item.description: "I can talk for a long time only when it's about something boring." -- Lydia Davis

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Jonah Lehrer
item.description: "The only way to maximize group creativity—to make the whole more than the sum of its parts—is to encourage a candid discussion of mistakes. In part, this is because the acceptance of error reduces cost. When you believe your flaws will be quickly corrected by the group, you're less worried about perfecting your contribution, which leads to a more candid conversation. We can only get it right when we talk about what we got wrong." -- Jonah Lehrer

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "The true measure of a man is not his intelligence or how high he rises in this freak establishment. No, the true measure of a man is this: how quickly can he respond to the needs of others and how much of himself he can give." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Carrie Fisher
item.description: "Resentment is like drinking poison and waiting for the other person to die. " -- Carrie Fisher

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Anne Carson
item.description: "You could take the entirety of the common sense of humans and put it in the palm of your hand and still have room for your dick." -- Anne Carson

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Jean Genet
item.description: "If we behave like those on the other side, then we are the other side. Instead of changing the world, all we'll achieve is a reflection of the one we want to destroy." -- Jean Genet

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Jean Genet
item.description: "A man must dream a long time in order to act with grandeur, and dreaming is nursed in darkness." -- Jean Genet

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Joseph Campbell
item.description: "I don't believe people are looking for the meaning of life as much as they are looking for the experience of being alive." -- Joseph Campbell

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "When people talk, listen completely. Most people never listen." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Nathan add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Three things in human life are important: the first is to be kind; the second is to be kind; and the third is to be kind." -- Henry James
